org.codefarm.engine

Class Algorithms

    Utility class for static methods (algorithms basically)
    Author:
    Oliver Thomas

    • Method Detail

      • getBiggestPrime

        public static java.math.BigInteger getBiggestPrime(java.math.BigInteger maxPerms)
        Returns a prime number (P) that satisfies P = 3 (mod 4), and is as close as possible to the maximum permutations of the code space but is less than the maximum permutations.

        The isProbablyPrime method of the BigInteger class is used to test primality. This method takes a single argument to specify the certainty of the prime test. 100 is passed which makes the test near-certain.

        Parameters:
        maxPerms - The maximum permutations of the code space
        Returns:
        A prime number (P) that satisfies P = 3 (mod 4), and is as close as possible to the maximum permutations of the code space but is less than the maximum permutations.

      • permute

        public static java.math.BigInteger permute(java.math.BigInteger p,
                           java.math.BigInteger x,
                           java.math.BigInteger xOrOperand)
        The permute function will return a randomised, unique BigInteger value in the range 0 < returnVal < p

        It passes x and p through the QRPFunction once, then applies an XOR operation to the resultant BigInteger (x2). Last of all, it runs the new BigInteger (x2withXor) through the QRPFunction once again.

        This ensures a very random distribution across the whole code space, but as the XOR function is a one-to-one function, uniqueness is still maintained.

        Parameters:
        p - A prime number that satisfies p = 3 mod 4
        x - The BigInteger seed value which should be a BigInteger in the range 0 < x < p. If x >= p then permute returns x
        xOrOperand - A BigInteger with bit length less than or equal to the bit length of p. Preferably, it has the same bit length
        Returns:
        The BigInteger permutation of x

      • QRPFunction

        public static java.math.BigInteger QRPFunction(java.math.BigInteger p,
                               java.math.BigInteger x)
        The QRPFunction will return a unique integer in the range 0 < x < p using the Quadratic Residue function

        The QRPFunction makes no check on the value of x or p. It assumes the caller has implemented those checks (i.e is x bigger than p, p is prime etc.)

        Parameters:
        x - A BigInteger that satisfies 0 < x < p. For all values of x where 2x < p, the quadratic residue (r) of x^2 will be unique. For all values of x where 2x >= p, the quadratic residue (p - r) will also be unique
        p - A prime number that satisfies p = 3 mod 4
        Returns:
        The unique (for 0 < x < p) BigInteger result
